intro: Crataegus chrysocarpa var. vigintistamina, commonly known as the golden-fruited hawthorn, is a variant of the hawthorn genus native to certain regions of Asia. It is characterized by its yellowish-orange berries, which are typically clustered in groups of twenty, as suggested by its varietal name. The plant features small, deciduous leaves and produces fragrant white or pale pink flowers in the spring. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Botanically, it is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been studied for potential medicinal properties.
